main.name: Xiaoqian Zhang's Page
main.description: I'm a Ph.D. student at UMass Boston, working with Prof. Bo Sheng
main.bio: I am a graduating Ph.D. student in the Computer Science Department at the University of Massachusetts Boston (under the supervision of Professor Bo Sheng). I received my B.A. from Skidmore College in 2012, majoring in Mathematics and Economics. Then I received my M.S. from New York University in 2014, majoring in Mathematics. My research interests include Congestion control in Disaggregated Storage Systems, Edge Computing, Mobile Computing, Big Data Analytics, and Distributed Systems. During the past four years, I have collaborated with Air Force Research Laboratory, Brookhaven National Laboratory, and Samsung on several research projects.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.degree: Bachelor of Art, Mathematics and Economics,

teaching.title: Introduction to Computer Concepts (CS105)
description: Instruct this introductory course for 8 semesters starting Spring 2019: both in-person and virtual lectures (during pandemic) with class size of more than 50 students
Deliver three 50-min lectures weekly, covering topics of overall computer concepts - computer applications, capabilities and limitations
Design course presentation slides, class exercises, exams, assignments
This course presents an overview of computer concepts - computer applications, capabilities and limitations
Motivate college students from diverse backgrounds to explore the subject of computer science

teaching.title: Applied Discrete Mathematics (CS 220)
description: Assist the instructor to develop, post and grade students’ assignments through the Grade Scope modules
Answer students’ questions through the Piazza course portal
Host in-person Q&A sessions during office hours twice a week

work.title: Contractor Research Assistant / Nonproliferation and National Security Department
description: Apply Deep Learning algorithms to conduct object-based identification and motion detection on International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) safeguards video surveillance
Implement YOLOv2, YOLOv3, and Cross-Camera Re-Identification algorithms to train Deep Learning models with IAEA safeguards surveillance camera image datasets to detect target objects
Tone hyper-parameters for Deep Learning models to optimize prediction results
Assist team with designing, testing and delivering the YOLOv3 based object detection UI software to IAEA safeguards to automate the process of suspicious objects detection with a 92.3% accuracy

work.title: Summer Internship Research Assistant / AFRL Eglin Laboratory
description: Detection of Rouge Transmitter in Radio Frequency Machine Learning (RFML) system with the image (graphed transmitter fingerprinting) classification approach
Assist team with pre-processing the transmitter fingerprinting images: the graphed raw radio frequency I/Q signal data image dataset
Participate in the design of a Deep Neural Network for multi-class classification for transmitter fingerprinting
